answerText: obesity[10] Leptin decreases the secretion of neuropeptide Y from the arcuate nucleus, which is located in this organ. This organ also secretes corticotrophin-releasing hormone, which acts on the anterior pituitary.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 3 | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about everyone's favorite appetite-suppressing hormone, leptin, for 10 points each: [10] People with this condition are resistant to the massive amounts of leptin circulating through their bloodstreams. It is diagnosed by measuring the body mass index, and those with BMI greater than 30 have this condition.
